definition: joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency

pinyin: Da4 xi1 yang2 yang2 zhong1 ji3

definition: lit. an ocean of writing/an impressive literary work (idiom)

sentences.english: That fellow exulted over a defeated rival.
sentences.chinese: 那家伙因击败对手而得意洋洋。

sentences.english: Lantern Festival day everywhere decorated, beaming.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节这天到处张灯结彩，喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: He lounged in an left armchair in a stance of deliberconsumed contempt.
sentences.chinese: 他懒洋洋地躺在扶手椅里，用意摆出一种藐视的架势。

sentences.english: She does not talk much, but she seems to have so much to write about in her diary.
sentences.chinese: 她不太爱说话，但是写起日记来却洋洋洒洒。

sentences.english: Bassy smiled proudly and said, "Did you guys see that?Eat the meat, not the hook."
sentences.chinese: 巴思洋洋得意地说，“看见了吧，吃肉，但是不上钩。

sentences.english: My head lazily leant leftward, close to Mum.
sentences.chinese: 头懒洋洋地歪向左边，靠近了母亲。

sentences.english: Americans face a bit sweeping, the Japanese are triumphant.
sentences.chinese: 美国人有点颜面扫地，日本人正得意洋洋。

sentences.english: Afternoon sun, relaxing and warm the heart of Orange lit.
sentences.chinese: 午后的阳光，暖洋洋的照得内心橙黄。

sentences.english: Eat slowly. Enjoy a lazy weekend day.
sentences.chinese: 吃慢点，享受一个懒洋洋的周末。

sentences.english: The whole square was alive with singing and rejoicing.
sentences.chinese: 整个广场歌声嘹亮，喜气洋洋。

sentences.english: I proudly pointed at the pig's feet braised in soy sauce, revelling in my own achievement.
sentences.chinese: 我指着红烧猪蹄，得意洋洋，自我陶醉。

sentences.english: The boss regrets incessantly, complacently of the look about that need a person.
sentences.chinese: 老板后悔不迭，差人四处寻找洋洋。

sentences.english: Will look through the scenery, merchant extremely.
sentences.chinese: 将风景看遍，喜洋洋至极。

sentences.english: The child lounged in an armchair.
sentences.chinese: 孩子懒洋洋地倚在扶手椅里。

definition: big pile of rocks/bighearted/open and honest
Nuannuan district of Keelung City 基隆市[Ji1 long2 shi4], Taiwan
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on
lasting for ages/long drawn out/remote in time or space/unhurried/a great number (of events)/preposterous/pensive
expanse of water/ooze/(onom.) bark/classifier for liquids: pool, puddle
